text:
New Bahru is new :)
I do like the aesthetics of the places and the selection of shops and cafes heavily curated which I appreciate

Everything is tip top! I believe this is great for the weekend brunch
Love the playground in the middle as well

In the vibrant locale of New Bahru, Singapore, there's a concept store that stands out for its innovative approach and exceptional offerings. This store seamlessly combines modern aesthetics with a curated selection of high-quality products, providing a unique shopping experience. Whether you're looking for the latest in fashion, home decor, or artisanal goods, this store in New Bahru is a treasure trove of delightful finds, each item reflecting a blend of creativity and craftsmanship.

The place is new and nice, new hype with new merchandise stall, franchises come here to grow their business

There’s a Cold Storage here.

Parking is ample.

Prices wise here don’t expect cheap, more to cafe prices.

Went to PPP cafe I think. Food and coffee is okay.

A new and charming concept

New bahru was previously a school that has been left doing nothing for a few years.

Lo and behold group, a recognized F&B lifestyle developer decided to turn this into a F&B and retail destination. I saw a similar concept in Hong Kong but honestly, I prefer this one in singapore given decent shops the place managed to consolidate.

There are restaurants, brunch places, coffee places, cold storage, retail and yoga classes. Definitely worth checking this place out.

Note : parking is limited and can be hard to secure during weekend

New Bahru is such a unique spot! Located in an old school building, it really brings back memories of school days. There are lots of nice stores, art studios, and few of food options, plus a supermarket. The outdoor spaces are great for hanging out with kids and pets. Just a heads up—it's probably best to visit on a sunny day since the outdoor areas wouldn’t be as enjoyable in the rain.
